page.title: 13"Bowcombe"-Religion.
page.content: {"When I was a boy, there was a {hundred in the congregation of a {Sunday evening, and afterwards the {whole family would go for a walk {together."}So said one of the older inhabitants of the area.{Nowadays the {congregation of the Parish church in {nearbye Shorwell "is far smaller, and {afterwards they go home and switch on {the telly." {Once the Church played a vital even {dominant role in a farming community {such as Bowcombe.}The farming year was closely tied to the ecclesiastic year: major farming events coinciding with corresponding religious festivals. Nowadays, only Harvest Thanksgiving remains of these festivals. When asked the reason for this, one farmer suggested that{"the Church has not {moved with the times. Everything else {has changed so why not the Church?"}
